name: remcos

procedures: T1027::[Remcos] uses RC4 and base64 to obfuscate data, including Registry entries and file paths.
T1055::[Remcos] has a command to hide itself through injecting into another process.
T1056.001::[Remcos] has a command for keylogging.
T1059.003::[Remcos] can launch a remote command line to execute commands on the victim’s machine.
T1083::[Remcos] can search for files on the infected machine.
T1090::[Remcos] uses the infected hosts as SOCKS5 proxies to allow for tunneling and proxying.
T1105::[Remcos] can upload and download files to and from the victim’s machine.
T1112::[Remcos] has full control of the Registry, including the ability to modify it.
T1113::[Remcos] takes automated screenshots of the infected machine.
T1115::[Remcos] steals and modifies data from the clipboard.
T1123::[Remcos] can capture data from the system’s microphone.
T1125::[Remcos] can access a system’s webcam and take pictures.
T1497.001::[Remcos] searches for Sandboxie and VMware on the system.
T1547.001::[Remcos] can add itself to the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence.
T1548.002::[Remcos] has a command for UAC bypassing.

description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) is a closed-source tool that is marketed as a remote control and surveillance software by a company called Breaking Security. [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) has been observed being used in malware campaigns.(Citation: Riskiq Remcos Jan 2018)(Citation: Talos Remcos Aug 2018)
